comments: This professsor is terrible. She talks over everyone, including the guest speakers and students asking questions. She is condescending and refuses to hold any proper discussions about the literature. She constantly talks about herself and her own work, in a bragging kind of way. Very rude. Expected better. She has ruined the CW department for me.

stu_tags: PARTICIPATION MATTERS  SKIP CLASS? YOU WON\'T PASS.  GIVES GOOD FEEDBACK
comments: The readings were difficult and a lot of it. Be prepared to invest a lot of time into the readings. I had a hard time comprehending some of the literature, but overall they were interesting. She explains the texts well and she breaks us up into small groups often to further discuss the literature. Not a bad class, just be prepared to read!

tag_professor: Gives good feedback (3)  Skip class? You won\'t pass. (2)  Get ready to read (2)  Caring (1)  Clear grading criteria (1)  Participation matters (1)  ACCESSIBLE OUTSIDE CLASS (1)
comments: Read the assignments and take notes in class, present well-organized and text-supported 3-5pg essays. Gelineau\'s a clear and interesting lecturer- I don\'t like the subject but I always enjoyed her explanations of it. She gives great feedback re: essay outlines and the Bb discussions. People who can\'t handle it give English majors a bad name!

tag_professor: Gives good feedback (3)  Skip class? You won\'t pass. (2)  Get ready to read (2)  Caring (1)  Clear grading criteria (1)  Participation matters (1)  ACCESSIBLE OUTSIDE CLASS (1)
comments: She is a great professor, but be prepared to invest some time into this class. She assigns a lot of reading and I was overwhelmed when I didn\'t leave myself a lot of time to get work done for her class. She\'s friendly, instructive and her lectures were always interesting, if a little dry. I would recommend her class.

comments: An extremely thorough and challenging teacher. She really does push her students and certainly puts in the hours. I would recommend her classes, although you must be prepared to do the reading to keep up with the volume of work she sets. However, a truly rewarding class.

comments: The worst professor- not only at Binghamton, but possibly in the entire world. Whoever gave this woman a job didn\'t realize that she would go mad with power. She takes herself and her awful class far too seriously. If avoiding her means jumping out of a building... well, you get the idea.
